question.text: Find the true statement from the following.

options.text: Some bacterial cell may have copy number of plasmid that varies from 15-100.
Vector should have many recognition sites for commonly used restriction enzymes so that alien DNA can attach to any one of the sites easily.
An ideal vector should have ori site, restriction site for different REN but not a selectable marker.

solution.text: Ori means the origin of replication, it is the site where the process of replication starts. Vectors should have only one restriction site for commonly used restriction enzyme but many sites for different enzyme. It should contain a selectable marker for selection of recombinants from non-recombinants.
